back_cards.definition_en: The use of violence to create fear
back_cards.example_en: The government condemned acts of terrorism.

back_cards.definition_en: A method to achieve political goals
back_cards.example_en: Terrorism disrupted the peace talks.
The city increased security to prevent terrorism.
Nations united to combat terrorism.
The attack was labeled as terrorism.
The respondent provided honest feedback.
Each respondent completed the questionnaire.
The respondent shared their opinion.
The respondent denied the claims.
The poll had 500 respondents.
The narrator described the scene vividly.

back_cards.definition_en: A voice in a film or book
back_cards.example_en: The narrator guided the audience through the plot.
The narrator shared her childhood memories.
The movie’s narrator was unreliable.
The narrator explained the documentary’s theme.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of casting a vote
back_cards.example_en: Voting is a civic duty.
The voting process was smooth.
Voting took place at the community center.
Young people are encouraged to join voting.
Voting for the new policy begins tomorrow.
The refugee sought safety in a new country.
The camp housed thousands of refugees.
The refugee shared her story of escape.
The refugee applied for legal status.
Aid groups helped the refugees.

back_cards.definition_en: A group gathered for a purpose
back_cards.example_en: The assembly discussed school rules.
The state assembly passed a new law.
The assembly of the machine took hours.
The assembly honored the volunteers.
The assembly voted on the proposal.
The company was accused of fraud.
He was arrested for credit card fraud.
The contract was based on fraud.
The scam was a clear case of fraud.
The fraud cost investors millions.
The project faced a budget limitation.
Her skills had no limitation.
The device’s limitation was its battery.
The law imposed a time limitation.
Lack of funds was a major limitation.
The partnership launched a new product.
Their partnership improved the community.
The partnership built a new school.

back_cards.definition_en: A mutual agreement to work together
back_cards.example_en: The partnership benefited both companies.
Her partnership with the designer was successful.
The car crashed into a tree.
The computer crashed during the update.
The waves crashed against the rocks.
He crashed the party without an invite.
She crashed on the couch after work.
Her speech was a representation of the team’s views.
The painting is a representation of nature.
The lawyer provided representation in court.
The logo is a representation of the brand.
The union ensured fair representation.
The Ministry of Education set new rules.
He joined a ministry to help the poor.
Her ministry focused on community outreach.
The Ministry of Health issued guidelines.
The ministry supported environmental efforts.
The flat surface was perfect for skating.
Her voice sounded flat during the speech.
The tire was completely flat.
The movie’s plot felt flat.
The rent was a flat rate of $500.
Her wise decision saved the project.
The wise elder advised the village.
It was wise to save money.
His wise words calmed the team.
She was wise to the risks involved.
She registered for the summer course.

back_cards.definition_en: To sign up for an event
back_cards.example_en: He registered to vote last week.
The thermometer registered a high temperature.
Her face registered surprise.
They registered their new business.
The comedy made everyone laugh.
She loves watching comedy films.
The mix-up was a comedy of errors.

back_cards.definition_en: A play or story with humor
back_cards.example_en: The theater performed a classic comedy.
His speech had elements of comedy.
She tapped his shoulder to get attention.

back_cards.definition_en: To draw liquid from a source
back_cards.example_en: They tapped the keg for the party.

back_cards.definition_en: To access or use a resource
back_cards.example_en: He tapped into his savings for the trip.
The hacker tapped the phone line.
She tapped her foot to the music.
The city improved its infrastructure.
The infrastructure supported economic growth.
The company upgraded its IT infrastructure.
The storm damaged the infrastructure.
Good infrastructure attracts businesses.
She bought organic vegetables.
The farm produces organic milk.
The recipe uses organic ingredients.
The project’s growth was organic.
Organic matter enriched the soil.
Islam is practiced by millions globally.

back_cards.definition_en: A faith based on the Quran
back_cards.example_en: She studied Islam in college.
Islam emphasizes charity and prayer.
The festival is part of Islam’s customs.
Islam’s holy month is Ramadan.
The team had diverse backgrounds.
Her interests are diverse and unique.
The museum displayed diverse artifacts.
They offered diverse solutions to the problem.
The city’s diverse culture attracted tourists.

back_cards.definition_en: Related to the mind or intellect
back_cards.example_en: The debate was highly intellectual.
She enjoyed intellectual discussions.
His approach was intellectual and logical.
The book appealed to intellectual readers.
The course covered intellectual history.
The lid was tight and hard to open.
Her jeans were too tight.
The budget was tight this month.
The game was a tight competition.
The team had a tight bond.

back_cards.definition_en: A place for ships to dock
back_cards.example_en: The ship arrived at the port.
The port handled millions of goods.

back_cards.definition_en: A connection point on a device
back_cards.example_en: The laptop has a USB port.
The port was busy with cargo.
The port connected the city to the world.
She believed her fate was sealed.
His fate depended on the jury’s decision.
Fate brought them together again.
The hero’s fate was tragic.
The team’s fate was to lose the game.
She had absolute confidence in her plan.
The rule was absolute and unbreakable.
He had absolute control over the project.
The silence was absolute at night.
The truth was absolute, not relative.
The dialogue between friends was lively.
The leaders held a dialogue for peace.
The movie’s dialogue was witty.
The dialogue improved their understanding.
The dialogue addressed community concerns.
The frequency of storms increased.
She checked her phone with frequency.

back_cards.definition_en: A measure in waves or signals
back_cards.example_en: The radio was set to a specific frequency.
The frequency of meetings was weekly.
The frequency of the sound was high.
The tribe gathered for a festival.
The tribe preserved its traditions.
The tribe lived by the river.
The gaming tribe met online.
The tribe elected a new leader.
The external walls were painted.
The company faced external pressure.
The device needs an external battery.
External trade boosted the economy.
The injury was only external.
She had an appointment with the doctor.
His appointment as manager was announced.
The appointment was set for 3 p.m.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of assigning a role
back_cards.example_en: Her appointment to the board was unanimous.
He missed his dental appointment.

back_cards.definition_en: To change into a different form
back_cards.example_en: She converted the file to PDF.
He converted to a new religion.
They converted the garage into a studio.
She converted her dollars to euros.

back_cards.definition_en: To adapt for a new use
back_cards.example_en: The old factory was converted into apartments.
The result was surprising to everyone.
Her speed was surprising for a beginner.
The news was surprising and sad.
His talent was surprising to the judges.
The plot twist was truly surprising.
The mobile unit helped in emergencies.
She uses a mobile app for banking.
His mobile lifestyle suited him.
The mobile sculpture spun in the wind.
Mobile networks improved in the area.
The establishment served great food.
The establishment of the club took years.
The new establishment opened downtown.
He challenged the political establishment.
The establishment hired more staff.
She was worried about her test results.
His worried expression was noticeable.
They were worried about the storm.
He felt worried before the interview.
She was worried for her lost dog.
She waved and said, ‘Bye!’

back_cards.definition_en: A way to end a conversation
back_cards.example_en: He said bye and hung up the phone.
The kids shouted bye as they left.
‘Bye, see you tomorrow!’ she said.
He whispered bye before leaving.
She went shopping for new clothes.
The mall is great for shopping.
Online shopping is very convenient.
They spent the day shopping downtown.
Her weekly shopping included groceries.
The celebrity signed autographs for fans.
The celebrity attended the premiere.
She became a celebrity after the show.
The celebrity endorsed a new product.
The celebrity spoke at the event.

back_cards.definition_en: A member of the U.S. Congress
back_cards.example_en: The congressman voted on the bill.
She met with her congressman.
The congressman addressed local issues.
The congressman proposed a new law.
The congressman served two terms.

back_cards.definition_en: To create a strong positive effect
back_cards.example_en: Her speech impressed the audience.
He impressed the boss with his work.
The painting impressed everyone at the gallery.
She impressed the judges with her skills.
His knowledge impressed his teacher.
The taxpayer funded the new school.
She filed her return as a taxpayer.
Taxpayers demanded better services.
The taxpayer supported the budget.
The new law affected every taxpayer.
She adapted to the cold weather.
He adapted the book into a movie.
They adapted to the new school.
The company adapted its strategy.

back_cards.definition_en: To fit into a new environment
back_cards.example_en: The plant adapted to dry soil.

back_cards.definition_en: In an open or public manner
back_cards.example_en: She publicly apologized for the mistake.
The event was publicly announced.
He publicly shared his opinion.
The report was publicly available.

back_cards.definition_en: In a way that’s not private
back_cards.example_en: They publicly celebrated the victory.
She took pride in her work.
His pride grew after winning.
The team played with pride.
The pride of lions roamed the savanna.
Her son was her greatest pride.
She donated clothing to charity.
The store sells trendy clothing.
His clothing was casual for the event.
Winter clothing kept her warm.
The clothing line was eco-friendly.
The car sped rapidly down the road.
The company grew rapidly in a year.

back_cards.definition_en: In a short amount of time
back_cards.example_en: She rapidly finished her homework.
The fire spread rapidly through the forest.
He responded rapidly to the email.

back_cards.definition_en: An area of expertise or control
back_cards.example_en: Science is her domain of knowledge.
The company bought a new domain.
The project falls under her domain.
The king ruled a vast domain.
The issue is in the public domain.
The event was mainly for students.

back_cards.definition_en: Chiefly or for the most part
back_cards.example_en: She mainly works from home.
The book is mainly about history.
The store sells mainly clothes.
The team was mainly young players.

back_cards.definition_en: The upper surface of a room
back_cards.example_en: The ceiling was painted white.
The budget hit its ceiling.

back_cards.definition_en: The top of an interior space
back_cards.example_en: A fan hung from the ceiling.
The debt ceiling was raised.
The ceiling had a leak after the rain.
